org.cloudbus.cloudsim.network

Class HostPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.network.HostPacket

  • public class HostPacket
extends Object
    HostPacket represents a packet that travels through the virtual network within a Host. It contains information about cloudlets which are communicating.
    Please refer to following publication for more details:
    • Saurabh Kumar Garg and Rajkumar Buyya, NetworkCloudSim: Modelling Parallel Applications in Cloud Simulations, Proceedings of the 4th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2011, IEEE CS Press, USA), Melbourne, Australia, December 5-7, 2011.
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
    Author:
    Saurabh Kumar Garg, Manoel Campos da Silva Filho

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HostPacket(int senderVmId, int receiverVmId, double dataLength, Cloudlet senderCloudlet, Cloudlet receiverCloudlet)
      Creates a packet to be sent to to a VM inside the Host of the sender VM.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HostPacket

        public HostPacket(int senderVmId,
                  int receiverVmId,
                  double dataLength,
                  Cloudlet senderCloudlet,
                  Cloudlet receiverCloudlet)
        Creates a packet to be sent to to a VM inside the Host of the sender VM.
        Parameters:
        senderVmId - id of the VM sending the packet
        receiverVmId - id of the VM that has to receive the packet
        dataLength - data length of the packet
        senderCloudlet - cloudlet sending the packet
        receiverCloudlet - cloudlet that has to receive the packet

    • Method Detail

      • getSendTime

        public double getSendTime()

        public void setSendTime(double sendTime)

        public double getReceiveTime()

      • setReceiveTime

        public void setReceiveTime(double receiveTime)

      • getSenderVmId

        public int getSenderVmId()
        Returns:
        id of the VM sending the packet. This is the VM where the sending cloudlet is running.

      • getReceiverVmId

        public int getReceiverVmId()
        Returns:
        id of the VM that has to receive the packet. This is the VM whwere th receiver cloudlet is running.

      • getSenderCloudlet

        public Cloudlet getSenderCloudlet()
        Returns:
        the cloudlet sending the packet.

      • getReceiverCloudlet

        public Cloudlet getReceiverCloudlet()
        Returns:
        the cloudlet that has to receive the packet.

      • getDataLength

        public double getDataLength()
        Returns:
        the length of the data being sent, that represents the size of the packet's payload (in bytes).
